sen.j: 御毛沼命（みけぬのみこと）は、日本神話に登場する日本の皇族である。
sen.e: Mikenu no mikoto was a member of Japanese Imperial family, who is mentioned in the Japanese Mythology.
Mikenu no mikoto was a member of Japanese Imperial family, who is mentioned in the Japanese Mythology.
Mikenu no mikoto was a member of Japanese Imperial family, who is mentioned in the Japanese Mythology.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』では三毛入野命（みけいりのみこと）、三毛野命（みけののみこと）と表記される。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), his name is written as Mikeiri no Mikoto (三毛入野命) or Mikeno no Mikoto (三毛野命).
sen.cmt: 三毛入野命（みけいりのみこと）→Mikeiri no mikoto (三毛入野命) と漢字表記を加えました。 三毛野命（みけののみこと）→Mikeno no mikoto (三毛野命)と漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), his name is written as Mikeiri no Mikoto (三毛入野命) or Mikeno no Mikoto (三毛野命).
In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), his name is written as Mikeiri no Mikoto (三毛入野命) or Mikeno no Mikoto (三毛野命).

sen.j: ウガヤフキアエズ、海神の娘であるタマヨリビメの子で、初代天皇・神武天皇の兄である。
sen.e: He was the son born between Ugayafukiaezu and the daughter of Watatsumi (tutelary of the sea), Tamayoribime, and he was the older brother of the first Emperor, Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: ウガヤフキアエズ→統一用語リストではUgaya Fukiaezuとありましたが、Ugayafukiaezu としました。
sen.e: He was a son born between Ugayafukiaezu and the daughter of Watatsumi (tutelary of the sea), Tamayoribime, and he was the older brother of the first Emperor, Emperor Jimmu.
sen.cmt: sonの冠詞をaに変更、jinmuを jimmuに変更。
sen.e: He was a son born between Ugayafukiaezu and the daughter of Watatsumi (tutelary of the sea), Tamayoribime, and he was the older brother of the first Emperor, Emperor Jimmu.

sen.j: 古事記および日本書紀本文・第一の一書では三男、日本書紀第二の一書では二男、第四の一書では四男となっており、第三の一書では登場しない。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the main text of the Nihonshoki, he is the third son, while in the 'alternate writing 2-1' transmitted by the Nihonshoki, he is the second don, in the 'alternate writing 4-1,'he was the forth son, respectively, and in the 'alternate writing 3-1,' there is no description about him.
sen.cmt: 日本書紀本文・第一の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the main text of the Nihonshokiとしました。 日本書紀第二の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 2-1' transmitted by the Nihonshokiとしました。 第四の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 4-1' としました。 第三の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 3-1'としました。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and a first writing in the Nihonshoki, he is referred to as the third son, while in a second writing in the Nihonshoki, he is the second son, in a fourth writing in the Nihonshoki, he is the fourth son, respectively; however in a third writing in the Nihonshoki, there is no description about him.
sen.cmt: 日本書紀本文・第一の一書→ a first writing in the Nihonshoki と訳出しました。他も同様です。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the main text and the first addendum to the Nihonshoki, he was the third son, but the second addendum mentions he was the second son and the fourth addendum describes him as the fourth son, however the third addendum to the Nihonshoki did not mention him.
sen.cmt: a first writing→the first addenduma second writing→the second addenduma fourth writing→the fourth addenduma third writing→the third addendum

sen.j: 兄弟に五瀬命（彦五瀬命）・稲飯命・若御毛沼命（神武天皇）がいる。
sen.e: His brothers were Itsuse no mikoto (Hikoitsuse no mikoto), Inahi no mikoto, Wakamikenu no mikoto(Emperor Jinmu)
sen.cmt: 以下の名前は、統一用語リストでは… no Mikotoとなっていましたが、すべて…no mikotoとしました：稲飯命→Inahi no mikoto, 若御毛沼命→Wakamikenu no mikoto
sen.e: His brothers were Itsuse no mikoto (Hikoitsuse no mikoto), Inahi no mikoto, Wakamikenu no mikoto(Emperor Jimmu).
His brothers were Itsuse no mikoto (Hikoitsuse no mikoto), Inahi no mikoto, Wakamikenu no mikoto(Emperor Jinmu).

sen.j: 古事記では、事績は何も記されずに「波頭を踏んで常世の国に渡った」とだけ記されている。
sen.e: According to the Kojiki, the only description about him is '[h]e crossed the sea on the crest of a wave to Tokoyo (the perpetual country).
sen.cmt: 「波頭を踏んで常世の国に渡った」→定訳不明：'he crossed the sea on the crest of a wave to Tokoyo (the perpetual country)'としました。
sen.e: In the Kojiki, the only description about him is that he crossed the sea over the waves to Tokoyo (the perpetual country).
sen.cmt: 「波頭を踏んで」をover the wavesと訳出しました。その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: In the Kojiki, the only description about him is that he crossed the sea over the waves to Tokoyo (the perpetual country).

sen.j: 日本書紀では、兄弟とともに神武東征に従うが、熊野に進んで行くときに暴風に遭い、「母も叔母も海神であるのに、どうして我々は波によって進軍を阻まれなければならないのか」と言って、やはり波頭を踏んで常世に行ったとしている。
sen.e: According to the Nihonshoki, he went to Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu) with the troops of his brothers, however, when they were hit by a storm on the way to Kumano, he resented the situation, and said, '[m]y mother and my aunt are Watatsumi (tutelaries of the sea), why on earth we had to be blocked by the ocean waves,' and went into the sea and crossed to Tokoyo on the crest of a wave.
sen.cmt: 神武東征→Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu)としました。 「母も叔母も海神であるのに、どうして我々は波によって進軍を阻まれなければならないのか」→定訳不明： 'my mother and my aunt are Watatsumi (tutelaries of the sea), why on earth we had to be blocked by the ocean waves' としました。
sen.e: According to the Nihonshoki, he joined Jimmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jimmu) with the troops of his brothers, however, when they were hit by a storm on the way to Kumano, he resented the situation, and said, 'my mother and my aunt are Watatsumi (tutelaries of the sea), why on earth we had to be blocked by the ocean waves,' and went to Tokoyo crossing the sea over the waves.
sen.cmt: went to をjoinedに変更、jinmu をjimmuに変更、「波頭を踏んで」をover the wavesと訳出し。
sen.e: According to the Nihonshoki, he joined Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu) with the troops of his brothers, however, when they were hit by a storm on the way to Kumano, he resented the situation, and said, 'my mother and my aunt are Watatsumi (tutelaries of the sea), why on earth we had to be blocked by the ocean waves,' and went to Tokoyo crossing the sea over the waves.

sen.j: 宮崎県高千穂町の伝承では、三毛入野命は常世に渡った（すなわち亡くなった）のではなく、兄弟たちからはぐれてしまったので、出発地の高千穂に帰還したのだとしている。
sen.e: According to the legend handed down in Takachiho-cho, Miyazaki Prefecture, Mikeiri no mikoto (Mikenu no Mikoto) did not go to Tokoyo (that means he went to the heaven), but he got lost from his brothers and retuned to the departure place, Takachiho.
sen.cmt: 常世に渡った（すなわち亡くなった）→go to Tokoyo (that means he went to the heaven)としました。
sen.e: According to the legend handed down in Takachiho-cho, Miyazaki Prefecture, Mikeiri no mikoto (Mikenu no Mikoto) did not go to Tokoyo (that means he went to the heaven), but he got lost from his brothers and retuned to the departure place, Takachiho.

According to the legend handed down in Takachiho-cho, Miyazaki Prefecture, Mikeiri no mikoto (Mikenu no Mikoto) did not go to Tokoyo (that means he went to the heaven), but he got lost from his brothers and retuned to the departure place, Takachiho.

sen.j: 高千穂には「鬼八（きはち）」という悪神がいて、人々を苦しめていたので、三毛入野命はこれを退治し高千穂の地を治めたと伝えている。
sen.e: In Takachiho, an evil deity called 'Kihachi' was troubling the people, and Mikeiri no mikoto defeated the deity and put Takachiho under control.
sen.cmt: 最上列では御毛沼命（みけぬのみこと）となっているので、名称は「三毛入野命」より「御毛沼命」で統一したほうがわかりやすいように思います。
sen.e: In Takachiho, an evil deity called 'Kihachi' was troubling the people, and Mikeiri no mikoto defeated the deity and put Takachiho under control.
In Takachiho, an evil deity called 'Kihachi' was troubling the people, and Mikeiri no mikoto defeated the deity and put Takachiho under control.

sen.j: 三毛入野命は高千穂神社の祭神であり、その妻子神とあわせて「十社大明神」と称されている。
sen.e: Mikeiri no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Takachiho-jinja Shrine, and it is one of the gracious deities collectively called 'Jissha-daimyojin'(ten gracious deities).
sen.cmt: 「十社大明神」→'Jissha-daimyojin''（ten gracious deities)としました。
sen.e: Mikeiri no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Takachiho-jinja Shrine, and it is one of the gracious deities collectively called 'Jissha-daimyojin'(ten gracious deities).
Mikeiri no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Takachiho-jinja Shrine, and it is one of the gracious deities collectively called 'Jissha-daimyojin'(ten gracious deities).

sen.j: 「ミケヌ」の「ミケ」は食物の意、「ヌ」は「主」の意とされる。
sen.e: In his name 'Mikenu,' 'mike' is said to mean the food, and 'nu' is said to mean '主''Dominus.'
In his name 'Mikenu,' 'mike' is said to mean the food, and 'nu' is said to mean '主''Dominus.'
In his name 'Mikenu,' 'mike' is said to mean the food, and 'nu' is said to mean '主''Dominus.'

sen.j: 「ミケイリ」は「食物に神霊が入る」の意と解される。
sen.e: In this way, 'Mikeiri' can be interpreted as '食物に神霊が入る''the spirit entering into the food.'
sen.cmt: 「食物に神霊が入る」→定訳不明'the spirit entering into the food' としました。
sen.e: In this way, 'Mikeiri' can be interpreted as '食物に神霊が入る''the spirit entering into the food.'
In this way, 'Mikeiri' can be interpreted as '食物に神霊が入る''the spirit entering into the food.'
